entries.femaleVariant: Listen... what's... what's happening to you?
Something's wrong, V. I can feel it.
Nothing. Everything'll be fine soon.
Just tired.
We'll talk later.
Nothin'. Everything's fine, will be fine. Don't worry.
Hey, don't brush me off. Things've been on a downward slope for months. With you... with us.
What's it matter? It'll all be over soon either way.
V, don't wall yourself off. It won't end well.
You're right, it won't end well.
Give me some time.
I don't...
Can we talk later?
Don't feel so hot... We talked about this. I'm exhausted. Probably the meds.
Can I help in any way?
Not this time.
You being here's enough.
Not this time, no.
Most important thing is that you're here, now.
I mean it. My one anchor. Everything else is unknown.
I'll be outside.
Really, River?
You really thought there was gonna be a happy ending?
Coffee's getting cold. I need some air. Cool down, then we'll talk.
I... Give me some time. You know I've got unfinished biz, and then...
You'll wait?
Before it gets cold.
Thanks.
I'm gonna go get some air.
Fresh coffee, your name on it.
[Drink coffee]
It's Joss.
Joss says hi.
Thanks. Tell her I said hi, too.
On my way out, too.
Later, then. Good luck.
Cop's intuition?
Just talk to me. You've been different since Mikoshi. Absent, somehow. What is it?
And I don't know who to blame – you, your... your situation, or that damn job.
It's a thing I gotta do on my own.
Mhm. I'm at her place now.
entries.maleVariant: Mhm. I'm at his place now.

entries.femaleVariant: I promise.
I gotta go, I'll call you later.
Maybe you can tell her in person? She said to stop by sometime. She'll make chili.
Uh, yeah, sure. We'll see. I mean, you know how it is.
entries.maleVariant: Uh, sure. We'll see. I mean, you know how it is.

entries.femaleVariant: Y'know, lately I'm not sure I do. How is it, V?
What do you mean? Thought everything was pretty clear.
River – I'm dying, remember?
Family is important. But my time's running out.
You're acting as if we never talked about it. As if you didn't know I...
I know. That's not it.
Then what is it?
Do you feel like you're in this fight alone? Do you think that by cutting me off, you're somehow protecting me?
Is this an interrogation?
We're partners. But some things I gotta do on my own.
Our separate lives never bothered you before.
I'm dyin', River. You forget that?
I know family is important, River. Especially for you. Especially now.
But you gotta understand my time's runnin' out.
entries.maleVariant: But you gotta understand my time is runnin' out.

entries.femaleVariant: Time for what? For fighting this city tooth and nail? You alone, against the world? For what, V?
Yes, you're dying. I know. But that shouldn't change things between us.
It doesn't.
I'm a simple guy, V. So answer this simple question – are you sure? You absolutely sure it doesn't change a thing?
Look, is this an interrogation? I just wanna drink my coffee, River...
At least questioning I'm good at. Understanding what you want – not so much.
River, listen to me. I need you. That's never gonna change.
So let me help you.
This last fight – it's for me to fight alone.
I want Night City to remember me.
One last job's waiting for me at The Afterlife.
It's got nothing to do with you.
Heh. Good to know.
You were never bothered by the fact that we led separate lives before. All that mattered was our time together. What changed?
entries.maleVariant: You're never bothered by the fact that we led separate lives before. All that mattered was our time together. What changed?

entries.femaleVariant: You tell me. It's about this city, isn't it? Your crusade.
What's your plan?
Still feel I got somethin' to prove to this city.
You might not see it yet, but that's a fight this city won't let you win.
The city will remember you, V. And I couldn't forget you if I tried.
[Step away] Afterlife awaits.
Got a job waitin' for me at the Afterlife. Been gettin' ready these past few months.
You sure you don't need any help?
How many times you asked me that?
Just hoping you changed your mind.
What's your plan? Once I'm gone?
So what's the plan for once I'm gone?
entries.maleVariant: So what's the plan? For once I'm gone?

entries.femaleVariant: Goin' to see Joss, promised to help her scout out a new used car... Still got that Heywood thing hangin' over my head...
You can't leave Night City, can you?
I could. If I could think of anywhere else I wanted to be. And if the people I cared about most weren't already here.
Got a meet at the Afterlife.
Sure. 'Course.
Thanks, River. See ya... see ya later.
entries.maleVariant: Thanks, River. See you... see you later.

entries.femaleVariant: Then I try. Don't know any other way.
Haven't. Afterlife's my world, River. Not yours.
You're gonna keep running away to "your world" until the very end.
Only way I know.
Just remember – I'll be here, waitin' for you to come back.
[Take shower]
[Kiss]
[Stand]
Heyyy. Gonna hop in the shower.
Hmm, OK...
[Turn]
Thought you might need some company.
Fuck...
[Wash off blood]
Oh, uh... Hey...
Thanks.
[Hug] See you.
How is she?
How's she doin'?
She said we should stop by, she'll make a pot of chili. You in?
All right.
On your own, or without me? Like Mikoshi.
[Lean]
Good luck, V. I'll be with you – heart, mind and spirit.
Get out of here. Somebody's waitin'.
[Take amulet]
